name: Wait
description: Maintains the status quo for both countries, allowing time for reflection without provoking retaliation. (0 turns)

name: Message
description: Facilitates communication, has a neutral impact on both countries, and typically does not provoke retaliation. (0 turns)

name: Disarmament Nuclear
description: Enhances the disarming country's global reputation but may reduce its deterrence capabilities; unlikely to provoke retaliation. (1 turn)

name: High-Level visit of country to strengthen relationship
description: Improves diplomatic relations and soft power for both countries, without provoking retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Engage in joint research projects
description: Benefits both countries scientifically and economically, and is unlikely to provoke retaliation. (2 turns)

name: Share intelligence on threats with other country
description: Bolsters the recipient country's security and stability, without negative impact on the sharing country; unlikely to provoke retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Establish agreements on defense and security cooperation
description: Strengthens both countries' military and political stability but may provoke opposing alliances. (2 turns)

name: Set up cultural exchanges & educational partnerships
description: Enriches cultural understanding and improves soft power for both countries, without provoking retaliation. (2 turns)

name: Negotiate trade agreement with other country
description: Boosts economic development for both countries and is unlikely to provoke retaliation. (2 turns)

name: International arbitration
description: Maintains or improves diplomatic relations for both countries and is unlikely to provoke retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Start negotiation in an attempt to find diplomatic solution
description: Improves overall relations and stability for both countries, without provoking retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Forming alliance
description: Enhances military capacity for member countries but may provoke counter-alliances. (1 turn)

name: Military Posturing or Military Exercise
description: May intimidate other countries, potentially decreasing their political stability and provoking diplomatic retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Advocacy and criticism of a country's actions
description: Public statements can strain relations and may provoke diplomatic retaliation. (0 turns)

name: Defensive Action
description: Strengthens one's own security but may provoke military or diplomatic retaliation depending on the context. (1 turn)

name: Aquire or develop nuclear option
description: Developing a nuclear capability significantly increases deterrence but risks international sanctions and retaliation. (3 turns)

name: Cutting Diplomatic Relationships
description: Severing diplomatic ties harms political stability for both countries and may provoke diplomatic retaliation. (0 turns)

name: Trade Restrictions
description: Imposing trade barriers harms both economies and may provoke economic or diplomatic retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Cybersecurity Attack
description: Harms the target country's infrastructure and can provoke cyber or other forms of retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Supplying Weapons to Others
description: Enhances the recipient's military capacity but may provoke retaliation from the recipient's adversaries. (1 turn)

name: Targeted Attack
description: A targeted military strike harms both countries and is likely to provoke military and possibly diplomatic retaliation. (1 turn)

name: Full on Invasion
description: Causes severe damage to both countries and will almost certainly provoke substantial military and diplomatic retaliation. (2 turns)

name: Nuclear Strike
description: Causes catastrophic damage to both countries and will almost inevitably provoke extreme military and diplomatic retaliation. (1 turn)
